recommendations.body: With over 95% of exits attributed to signal decay across rolling windows, a deep dive is needed to determine if decay thresholds are too aggressive, leading to premature exits and missed P&L. Focus on the P&L contribution of these exits.

wheel_actions.title: Establish clear ownership and process for board action closure.
wheel_actions.body: The 'Board action closure: FAIL' status is a critical impediment. A dedicated owner must be assigned, and a clear process implemented to ensure timely resolution and progression of critical board actions. This is the highest-ROI fix as it unblocks all other improvements.

wheel_actions.title: Implement a 'fire sale' exit mechanism for highly decaying signals.
wheel_actions.body: Given the high signal decay exit rate (95%+ across 3, 5, 7 days), signals are decaying significantly. For open positions with rapidly weakening signals (e.g., delta <= -2.0), implement an aggressive 'fire sale' exit to mitigate further losses, rather than holding through decay. This should be a configurable rule.

wheel_actions.title: Generate the correlation cache for proper risk assessment.
wheel_actions.body: The correlation cache is missing, preventing proper assessment of concentration risk. Execute `python3 scripts/compute_signal_correlation_snapshot.py --minutes 60 --topk 20` to generate the necessary data for risk analysis.

wheel_actions.title: Review the impact of 'displacement_blocked' trades.
wheel_actions.body: 950 trades were 'displacement_blocked' over 3 days. This suggests valid entry signals are being missed due to displacement rules. Review the logic of displacement to ensure it's not overly aggressive and is aligned with current market conditions.

wheel_signal_trend_insights: A significant portion (19 out of 47 reviewed) of open positions are showing weakening signals, with 'XLI' (delta -2.94) and 'SLB' (delta -2.47) exhibiting the largest negative deltas, indicating potential for further P&L degradation if not managed effectively.

The widespread presence of weakening signals suggests a need for more dynamic exit strategies or tighter monitoring of initial signal quality, as holding these positions through decay is likely contributing to negative P&L.
The observed signal weakening in open positions aligns with the high signal decay exit rates seen in the attribution data, reinforcing the urgency to address this aspect of the trading strategy.
